strapiPost.title: Fun and Philanthropy Collide During The Amazeum's Ungala
strapiPost.content:
Have fun for a great cause during the Scott Family Amazeum's UnGala presented by Nabholz, the museum's annual FUNdraiser for ages 21+, where you can play like a kid, eat, drink, and experience one-of-a-kind activities that spark creativity and curiosity, on Apr 21, from 6-10p.

  • Never too old to play: There will be so many hands-on experiences to try, like light painting, wood turning, percussion art, a build-your-own-scent bouquet station, and even an adult-size ball pit. When you need a break from the activities, enjoy the all-you-can-eat food truck buffet and tipsy chemistry cocktails presented by Spectrum Brands!
  • For the kids: The Ungala supports the Amazeum's nonprofit mission to keep the cost of general admission low, host Priceless Nights, and provide professional development opportunities for local educators.

Who are you inviting to the UnGala next weekend? Get your tickets HERE.
